sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: Collection of top-notch calendar components for seamless event scheduling. Whether you prefer ready-to-use setups or enjoy tweaking code for a tailored experience, these calendars have you covered.
articles.title: Event Calendars For Web Made Easy With These Commercial Options

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Our next book, ‚ÄúSuccess at Scale‚Äù is finally at the printer, which means we‚Äôll be shipping books soon. It‚Äôs also your last chance to get the book at the presale price. Get your copy and save now!
articles.title: Success At Scale: Last Chance For Pre-Sale Price

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: In Part 1 of this series, Temani Afif explored different CSS techniques to create tooltip shapes. The main challenge was to rely on a single element and create optimized code that could easily be controlled using CSS variables to update the size, shape, and position of the tail. In this second part, you are going explore more shapes.
articles.title: Modern CSS Tooltips And Speech Bubbles (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez)
articles.description: [‚ÄúGatsby headaches‚Äù](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2023/06/gatsby-headaches-i18n-part-1/) are over. Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez reflects on his decision to stop using Gatsby as his go-to framework. Through a detailed examination of its strengths and weaknesses, he provides valuable insights and alternative options for developers navigating their tooling choices.
articles.title: The End Of My Gatsby Journey

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Tooltips are a very common pattern used in CSS for years. There are a lot of ways to approach tooltips in CSS, though some evoke headaches with all the magic numbers they require. In this article, Temani Afif presents modern techniques to create tooltips with the smallest amount of markup and the greatest amount of flexibility.
articles.title: Modern CSS Tooltips And Speech Bubbles (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? Well, then our new batch of desktop wallpapers is for you. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for March 2024. Enjoy!
articles.title: Waiting For Spring (March 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: The Performance API is a set of standards for measuring and evaluating performance metrics with JavaScript. This article demonstrates how to use the Performance API to generate performance metrics directly in the DOM to create your own reporting.
articles.title: Reporting Core Web Vitals With The Performance API

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yichan Wang)
articles.description: Digital designer Yichan Wang has put together this collection of strategies and selling points to help you encourage and advocate for accessibility in your place of work, including useful scripts you can use as starting points.
articles.title: A Web Designer‚Äôs Accessibility Advocacy Toolkit

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederik Dohr)
articles.description: It‚Äôs well-established that the web faces wide-ranging usability and performance issues, from user-hostile UI patterns and twisted search results to sluggish performance and battery-draining bloat. In this article, Frederik examines one small-but-significant aspect where developers take the reins: Painting pixels on the screen.
articles.title: Vanilla JavaScript, Libraries, And The Quest For Stateful DOM Rendering

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Color accessibility is more than just ticking boxes. Even with good contrast, some color palettes can make interfaces challenging for users. Here are some practical guidelines to ensure more inclusive design for colorblind people. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: A Practical Guide To Designing For Colorblind People

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: Accessibility goes beyond making products user-friendly. It can significantly impact the quality of life for people with disabilities. Kate Kalcevich shares lessons she learned from assistive technology users ‚Äî challenges and barriers they encounter on mobile devices.
articles.title: Mobile Accessibility Barriers For Assistive Technology Users

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Every week we publish a lot of great content on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. New people sometimes wonder where to start and what order to watch the courses. Well, if you want to become a back end developer, this is where to start. We just released our back end developer
articles.title: Back End Developer Roadmap

articles.author: Rajdeep Singh
articles.description: Neovim [https://neovim.io/] is a popular IDE and is a solid alternative to VS Code. Neovim supports every major programming language and allows you to build anything, anywhere.  Neovim can be a bit problematic to start with, especially for newcomers. Writing a Neovim configuration from scratch is often difficult. To
articles.title: How to Install Neovim Using the nvchad Framework

articles.author: Daniel Asaboro
articles.description: Programming can be a rollercoaster ride. It catapults you from feeling like a genius to feeling utterly clueless, and back again ‚Äî all in the blink of an eye.  What's even more wild is that this cycle repeats itself countless times throughout the day, and for the entirety of
articles.title: How to Use and Create Streams from Scratch in Dart and Flutter ‚Äì a Beginner's Guide

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp Community YouTube channel that will teach you how to use Crowdin, a leading cloud-based localization platform. The course was created by Estefania Cassingena Navone. She's an experienced teacher and also runs the freeCodeCamp Espa√±ol channel. What's Crowdin? Crowdin is a cloud-based solution
articles.title: Localize Your Websites with Crowdin

articles.author: Manish Shivanandhan
articles.description: Have you ever wondered how to use Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT in your app? Yes, there is the OpenAI API. You can use it to generate responses based on prompts. But what if you want to build a complex application with LLMs integrated tightly into the user experience?
articles.title: How to Build Better AI Workflows with Langchain

articles.author: Jessica Wilkins
articles.description: Arrays are common data structures in JavaScript, and it is important to know how to work with them. Common operations on arrays include adding or removing elements from the beginning, end or at a specific index. In this article, you will learn how to work with the built in JavaScript
articles.title: How to Add and Remove Elements from Arrays in JavaScript

articles.author: Fatuma Abdullahi
articles.description: In this article, you'll build a task manager application that has some artificial intelligence capabilities and is voice-enabled, sortable, and searchable.  As an extra, the application will have dark mode support that respects the users' system preferences. The application will be able to create, read, update and delete (CRUD)
articles.title: How to Build an AI-enhanced Task App with React and Appwrite

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Are you gearing up for coding interviews and looking to strengthen your grasp on JavaScript algorithms? We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp Community YouTube channel that will equip you with the essential skills to excel in Leetcode-style coding challenges. Mukhtar from Coding Monkey developed this course. The course
articles.title: Top 10 JavaScript Algorithms for Coding Challenges

articles.author: Daniel Iwugo
articles.description: Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the world of Virtual Machines üñ•Ô∏è So you‚Äôve discovered the world of ethical hacking and you want to try your hands on something. articles.title: Ethical Hacking 101 ‚Äì How to Set Up Metasploitable on Your Computer

articles.author: Amr Hesham
articles.description: Hello everyone! I'm a Software engineer who is interested in low-level programming, compilers, and tool development. At the end of 2023, I published my first article on freeCodeCamp about how I created a SQL-like Language to run queries on local Git repositories [/news/gql-design-and-implementation/]. If you want a bit more context,
articles.title: How to Run SQL-Like Queries on Files
